			<div id="siteNotice"><div id="centralNotice" class="cn-wlm_2024_in"><style> 
.skin-monobook #siteNotice p {
   padding-left: 90px !important;
   padding-right: 64px !important;
   padding-top: 4px !important;
}

/* Resets */
.cbnnr * {
    margin: 0;
    padding: 0;
}

/* Box-sizing */
.cbnnr,
.cbnnr *,
.cbnnr *:before,
.cbnnr *:after {
    -moz-box-sizing: border-box;
    -webkit-box-sizing: border-box;
    box-sizing: border-box;
}

/* Font sizes and line heights */

.cbnnr-message {
    font-family: "Helvetica Neue", "Helvetica", "Arial", sans-serif;
    font-weight: medium;
    font-size: 13px;
    line-height: 1.4;
    color: #555A5F !important;
    text-align: left;
}

.cbnnr-special .cbnnr-message {
    color: #d9e0f5 !important;
}

.cbnnr-cta {
    font-size: 15px;
    font-weight: bold;
    color: #222;
}

.cbnnr-special .cbnnr-cta {
    color: white;
}



@media all and (min-width: 720px) {
    .cbnnr-message { 
        font-size: 18px; 
        line-height: 1.5;
     }
    .cbnnr-cta { font-size: 20px; }
}

/* Styles */


.cbnnr {
    position: relative;
    margin-bottom: 12px;
}

/* Hide banner when Wikipedia site search is enabled */
.overlay-enabled .cbnnr {
    display: none !important;
}


.cbnnr-main {
    position: relative;
    clear: both;
    padding: 10px;
    border: 1px solid #8F0000;
    min-height: 88px;
}

.cbnnr-special .cbnnr-main {
    background-color: #c8ccd1;
    border: none;
}

@media all and (min-width: 720px) {
    .cbnnr-main {
        padding: 15px;
        min-height: 98px;
    }
}

.skin-minerva .cbnnr-main {
        border: none;
        border-bottom: 1px solid #c8ccd1;
    }

@media all and (min-width: 1000px) {
    .skin-minerva .cbnnr-main {
        border: 1px solid #c8ccd1;
        margin-top: 20px;
    }
}

.cbnnr-message {
    display: block;
}

.rtl .cbnnr-message {
    text-align:right;
}

.cbnnr-icon {
    width: 68px;
    height: 68px;
    border-radius: 2px;
    overflow: hidden;
    top: 50%;
    position: absolute;
    float: left;
    transform: translateY(-50%);
    left: 10px;
    overflow: hidden;
}
.rtl .cbnnr-icon {
    right: 15px;
}
@media all and (min-width: 720px) {
    .cbnnr-icon {
       left: 15px;
    }
    .rtl .cbnnr-icon {
       right: 15px;
    }
}

.cbnnr-icon-border {
    border: 1px solid #c8ccd1;
}

.cbnnr-icon img {
    max-width: 100%;
    max-height: 100%;
    position: absolute;
    top: 0;
    left: 0;
}

.cbnnr-icon-border img {
    max-width: 80%;
    max-height: 80%;
    position: absolute;
    top: 50%;
    left: 50%;
    transform: translate(-50%,-50%);
}


.cbnnr-message p {
    padding-left: 83px;
    padding-right: 64px;
    padding-top: 5px;
    margin: auto;
}

.rtl .cbnnr-message p {
    padding-right: 83px;
    padding-left: 64px;
    padding-top: 5px;
    margin: auto;
}

    padding-left: 83px;
    padding-right: 145px;
    padding-top: 5px;
    margin: auto;
}

.rtl .cbnnr-message-rimg p {
    padding-right: 83px;
    padding-left: 145px;
    padding-top: 5px;
    margin: auto;
}

    .cbnnr-message p  {
       padding-left: 78px;
       padding-right: 54px;
       padding-top: 15px;
    }
    .rtl .cbnnr-message p  {
       padding-right: 78px;
       padding-left: 54px;
       padding-top: 15px;
    }
}

@media all and (max-width: 500px) {
    .cbnnr-message p  {
       padding-left: 5px;
    }

       padding-right: 75px;
    }

       display:none;
    }

}

    .skin-minerva .cbnnr-message p  {
       padding-left: 78px;
    }

       padding-left: 0;
       padding-right: 78px;
    }

       display:block;
    }

}

    .skin-minerva .cbnnr-message p  {
       padding-left: 5px;
    }


    .skin-minerva .cbnnr-icon {
       display:none;
    }

}
.cbnnr-headline,
.cbnnr-text {
    display: block;
}

@media all and (min-width: 720px) {
    .cbnnr-headline,
    .cbnnr-text {
        display: inline;
    }
    .cbnnr-headline:after {
        content: ' | ';
    }
}

.cbnnr-cta {
    display: block;
    margin-top: 4px;
}

@media all and (min-width: 720px) {
    .cbnnr-cta {
        margin-top: 2px;
    }
}

.cbnnr-cta:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
}

.cbnnr-rightimg {
    display:none;
}

.cbnnr-rightimgshow {
    display:block;
    top: 50%;
    right: 75px;
    transform: translateY(-50%);
    position: absolute;
}

.rtl .cbnnr-rightimgshow {
    left: 75px;
    right: unset;
}

@media all and (max-width: 720px) {
    .cbnnr-rightimg {
        display:none;
    }
}

/* --- Close Options --- */

.cbnnr-close {
    cursor: pointer;
    position: absolute;
    top: 50%;
    right: 10px;
    transform: translateY(-50%);
    z-index: 1;
    opacity: .8;
    background: #72777d22;
    border-radius: 50%;
    padding: 12px;
    width: 44px;
    height: 44px;
    transition: all .3s ease-in-out;  
}

.cbnnr-special .cbnnr-close {
    background: rgba(255,255,255,.5);
    opacity: 1;
}

body.rtl .cbnnr-close {
    left: 10px;
    right: unset;
}

@media all and (min-width: 720px) {
    .cbnnr-close   {
       right: 15px;
    }
    body.rtl .cbnnr-close {
        left: 15px;
        right: unset;
    }
}

.cbnnr-close:hover { 
    opacity: 1;
}

.cbnnr-special .cbnnr-close:hover  {
    background: rgba(255,255,255,.7);
}

.cbnnr-close-icon {
    background: 
       linear-gradient(transparent,transparent),
       url("data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg xmlns=%22http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%22 width=%2220%22 height=%2220%22 viewBox=%220 0 20 20%22%3E%3Ctitle%3Eclose%3C/title%3E%3Cpath d=%22M4.34 2.93l12.73 12.73-1.41 1.41L2.93 4.35z%22/%3E%3Cpath d=%22M17.07 4.34L4.34 17.07l-1.41-1.41L15.66 2.93z%22/%3E%3C/svg%3E");
    height: 100%;
    width: 20px;
    min-width: 20px;
    min-height: 20px;
    background-size: contain;
    background-position: center center;
    background-repeat: no-repeat;
    opacity: 0.8;
}

.cbnnr-special .cbnnr-close-icon {
    background: 
       linear-gradient(transparent,transparent),
       url("data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg xmlns=%22http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%22 width=%2220%22 height=%2220%22 fill=%22%23ffffff%22 viewBox=%220 0 20 20%22%3E%3Ctitle%3Eclose%3C/title%3E%3Cpath d=%22M4.34 2.93l12.73 12.73-1.41 1.41L2.93 4.35z%22/%3E%3Cpath d=%22M17.07 4.34L4.34 17.07l-1.41-1.41L15.66 2.93z%22/%3E%3C/svg%3E");
}


.cbnnr-special .cbnnr-close-icon  {
    opacity: 1;
}


.cbnnr-special .cbnnr-close-icon {
    /* need new svg */
}

.cbnnr-close-icon:hover { 
    opacity: 1;
}

#cnotice-translation-link {
    position: absolute;
    right: 65px;
    bottom: 0px;
    font-size: 0.8em;
    white-space: nowrap;
}

#cnotice-translation-link:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
}

.rtl #cnotice-translation-link {
    text-align: left;
    left: 65px;
}

/* Dark mode */
html.skin-theme-clientpref-night .cbnnr-message {
    color: #a2a9b1 !important;
}
html.skin-theme-clientpref-night .cbnnr-cta {
    color: #ddd;
}
html.skin-theme-clientpref-night .cbnnr-close-icon {
    filter: invert(1);
}
@media (prefers-color-scheme: dark) {
    html.skin-theme-clientpref-os .cbnnr-message {
        color: #a2a9b1 !important;
    }
    html.skin-theme-clientpref-os .cbnnr-cta {
        color: #ddd;
    }
    html.skin-theme-clientpref-os .cbnnr-close-icon {
        filter: invert(1);
    }
}
</style>

<div class="cbnnr" id="wlm_2024_in" style="display: block;">

    <div class="cbnnr-main">

        <a href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Commons:Wiki_Loves_Monuments_2024_in_India" class="cbnnr-message fade" id="banner1">

            <figure class="cbnnr-icon ">
                <img src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Wiki_Loves_Monuments_Logo_notext.svg/70px-Wiki_Loves_Monuments_Logo_notext.svg.png" alt="">
            </figure>

            <p>
                <span class="cbnnr-text">Wiki Loves Monuments: Photograph a monument, help Wikipedia and win!</span>
                <span class="cbnnr-cta">Learn more</span>
            </p>

            <figure class="cbnnr-rightimg">
                <img src="" alt="">
            </figure>

        </a>

        <div class="cbnnr-close">
            <div class="cbnnr-close-icon" href="#" title="Hide" onclick="mw.centralNotice.hideBanner(); return false;"></div>
        </div>

    </div>

</div>
<script>
var cbnnr = cbnnr || {};

cbnnr.rewrite_url = function() {
  url = '';
  rimg = '';
  switchlang ='';
  switch(Geo.country) {

   case 'XX':
     url = 'https://www.wikilovesmonuments.org/?pk_campaign=Centralnotice';
     break;

  }
 if(url!='') $("a.cbnnr-message").attr("href",url);
 if(rimg!='') $(".cbnnr-rightimg img").css('display', 'block');
 if(rimg!='') $(".cbnnr-rightimg img").attr('src', rimg);
 if(rimg!='') $(".cbnnr-rightimg").addClass("cbnnr-rightimgshow");
 if(rimg!='') $(".cbnnr-message").addClass("cbnnr-message-rimg");
 if(switchlang!='') $(".cbnnr-text").html(switchlang);
}

cbnnr.show = function() {
    $('.cbnnr').css('display', 'block');
};

$(function() {


    if ( !mw.centralNotice.bannerData.hideResult ) {
        cbnnr.rewrite_url();
        cbnnr.show();
    }

});
</script></div><!-- CentralNotice --></div>

data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1239334494">@media screen{html.skin-theme-clientpref-night .mw-parser-output div:not(.notheme)>.tmp-color,html.skin-theme-clientpref-night .mw-parser-output <td style="background:#74ACDF;"><span class="mw-image-border" typeof="mw:File"><a href="/wiki/File:Virat_Kohli_portrait.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img alt="Smiling during press conference." src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/15/Virat_Kohli_portrait.jpg/100px-Virat_Kohli_portrait.jpg" decoding="async" width="100" height="106" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/15/Virat_Kohli_portrait.jpg/150px-Virat_Kohli_portrait.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/15/Virat_Kohli_portrait.jpg/200px-Virat_Kohli_portrait.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1899" data-file-height="2012"></a></span></td>
<td style="background:#74ACDF;"><span style="font-size:0.8em;"><span class="tmp-color" style="color:#000">This article is part of a series about</span></span><br><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><span style="font-size:1.35em;"><a class="mw-selflink selflink"><span class="tmp-color" style="color:#000">Virat Kohli</span></a></span></span></span></td>

</tr><tr><td class="sidebar-navbar" style="text-align:center;"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1129693374"><style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1239400231">.mw-parser-output .navbar{display:inline;font-size:88%;font-weight:normal}.mw-parser-output .navbar-collapse{float:left;text-align:left}.mw-parser-output .navbar-boxtext{word-spacing:0}.mw-parser-output .navbar ul{display:inline-block;white-space:nowrap;line-height:inherit}.mw-parser-output .navbar-brackets::before{margin-right:-0.125em;content:"[ "}.mw-parser-output .navbar-brackets::after{margin-left:-0.125em;content:" ]"}.mw-parser-output .navbar li{word-spacing:-0.125em}.mw-parser-output .navbar a>span,.mw-parser-output .navbar a>abbr{text-decoration:inherit}.mw-parser-output .navbar-mini abbr{font-variant:small-caps;border-bottom:none;text-decoration:none;cursor:inherit}.mw-parser-output .navbar-ct-full{font-size:114%;margin:0 7em}.mw-parser-output .navbar-ct-mini{font-size:114%;margin:0 4em}html.skin-theme-clientpref-night .mw-parser-output .navbar li a abbr{color:var(--color-base)!important}@media(prefers-color-scheme:dark){html.skin-theme-clientpref-os .mw-parser-output .navbar li a abbr{color:var(--color-base)!important}}@media print{.mw-parser-output .navbar{display:none!important}}</style><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:Virat_Kohli_series" title="Template:Virat Kohli series"><abbr title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:Virat_Kohli_series" title="Template talk:Virat Kohli series"><abbr title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a href="/wiki/Special:EditPage/Template:Virat_Kohli_series" title="Special:EditPage/Template:Virat Kohli series"><abbr title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p><b>Virat Kohli</b> (<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1177148991">.mw-parser-output .IPA-label-small{font-size:85%}.mw-parser-output .references .IPA-label-small,.mw-parser-output .infobox .IPA-label-small,.mw-parser-output .navbox .IPA-label-small{font-size:100%}</style><span class="IPA-label IPA-label-small">Hindi pronunciation:</span> <span class="IPA nowrap" lang="hi-Latn-fonipa"><a href="/wiki/Help:IPA/Hindi_and_Urdu" title="Help:IPA/Hindi and Urdu">[ʋɪˈɾɑːʈ<span class="wrap"> </span>ˈkoːɦli]</a></span> <span class="noprint"><span class="ext-phonos"><span data-nosnippet="" id="ooui-php-1" class="ext-phonos-PhonosButton noexcerpt ext-phonos-PhonosButton-emptylabel oo-ui-widget oo-ui-widget-enabled oo-ui-buttonElement oo-ui-buttonElement-frameless oo-ui-iconElement oo-ui-buttonWidget" data-ooui="{&quot;_&quot;:&quot;mw.Phonos.PhonosButton&quot;,&quot;href&quot;:&quot;\/\/upload.wikimedia.org\/wikipedia\/commons\/transcoded\/e\/e4\/Virat_Kohli.ogg\/Virat_Kohli.ogg.mp3&quot;,&quot;rel&quot;:[&quot;nofollow&quot;],&quot;framed&quot;:false,&quot;icon&quot;:&quot;volumeUp&quot;,&quot;data&quot;:{&quot;ipa&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;lang&quot;:&quot;en&quot;,&quot;wikibase&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;file&quot;:&quot;Virat Kohli.ogg&quot;},&quot;classes&quot;:[&quot;ext-phonos-PhonosButton&quot;,&quot;noexcerpt&quot;,&quot;ext-phonos-PhonosButton-emptylabel&quot;]}"><a role="button" tabindex="0" href="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/transcoded/e/e4/Virat_Kohli.ogg/Virat_Kohli.ogg.mp3" rel="nofollow" aria-label="Play audio" title="Play audio" class="oo-ui-buttonElement-button"><span class="oo-ui-iconElement-icon oo-ui-icon-volumeUp"></span><span class="oo-ui-labelElement-label"></span><span class="oo-ui-indicatorElement-indicator oo-ui-indicatorElement-noIndicator"></span></a></span><sup class="ext-phonos-attribution noexcerpt navigation-not-searchable"><a href="/wiki/File:Virat_Kohli.ogg" title="File:Virat Kohli.ogg">ⓘ</a></sup></span></span>; born 5 November 1988) is an Indian <a href="/wiki/Cricket" title="Cricket">international cricketer</a> who plays <a href="/wiki/Test_cricket" title="Test cricket">Test</a> and <a href="/wiki/One_Day_International" title="One Day International">ODI</a> cricket for the <a href="/wiki/India_national_cricket_team" title="India national cricket team">Indian national team</a>. A former <a href="/wiki/Captain_(cricket)" title="Captain (cricket)">captain</a> in all formats of the game, Kohli retired from the <a href="/wiki/Twenty20_International" title="Twenty20 International">T20I</a> format following India's win at the <a href="/wiki/2024_ICC_Men%27s_T20_World_Cup" title="2024 ICC Men's T20 World Cup">2024 T20 World Cup</a>. He's a right-handed <a href="/wiki/Batting_(cricket)" title="Batting (cricket)">batsman</a> and an occasional unorthodox right arm quick <a href="/wiki/Bowling_(cricket)" title="Bowling (cricket)">bowler</a>. Kohli is regarded as one of the greatest batsmen of all time and the greatest in the modern era. He holds the highest <a href="/wiki/Indian_Premier_League" title="Indian Premier League">IPL</a> run-scorer record, ranks third in <a href="/wiki/Twenty20_International" title="Twenty20 International">T20I</a>, third in <a href="/wiki/One_Day_International" title="One Day International">ODI</a>, and stands the fourth-highest in international cricket.<sup id="cite_ref-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-5"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>4<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He also holds the record for scoring the most centuries in ODI cricket and is second in the <a href="/wiki/List_of_cricketers_by_number_of_international_centuries_scored" title="List of cricketers by number of international centuries scored">list of most international centuries scored</a>.
</p><p>Kohli was a key member of the Indian team that won the <a href="/wiki/2011_Cricket_World_Cup" title="2011 Cricket World Cup">2011 Cricket World Cup</a>, <a href="/wiki/2013_ICC_Champions_Trophy" title="2013 ICC Champions Trophy">2013 Champions Trophy</a> and <a href="/wiki/2024_T20_World_Cup" class="mw-redirect" title="2024 T20 World Cup">2024 T20 World Cup</a> and captained India to win the <a href="/wiki/ICC_World_Test_Championship_Mace" class="mw-redirect" title="ICC World Test Championship Mace">ICC Test mace</a> three consecutive times in 2017, 2018, and 2019.<sup id="cite_ref-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-6"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>5<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He represents <a href="/wiki/Royal_Challengers_Bengaluru" class="mw-redirect" title="Royal Challengers Bengaluru">Royal Challengers Bengaluru</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Indian_Premier_League" title="Indian Premier League">Indian Premier League</a> and <a href="/wiki/Delhi_cricket_team" title="Delhi cricket team">Delhi</a> in <a href="/wiki/Cricket_in_India" title="Cricket in India">domestic cricket</a>.
</p><p>In 2013, Kohli was ranked number one in the <a href="/wiki/ICC_Men%27s_Player_Rankings" title="ICC Men's Player Rankings">ICC rankings</a> for ODI batsmen. In 2015, he achieved the summit of T20I rankings.<sup id="cite_ref-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-7"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>6<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In 2018, he was ranked top Test batsman, making him the only Indian cricketer to hold the number one spot in all three formats of the game. He is the first player to score 20,000 runs in a decade. In 2020, the <a href="/wiki/International_Cricket_Council" title="International Cricket Council">International Cricket Council</a> named him the male cricketer of the decade.<sup id="cite_ref-8" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-8"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>7<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Kohli has garnered <a href="/wiki/ICC_Awards" title="ICC Awards">10 ICC Awards</a> which is more than any player in International Cricket, making him the most decorated player in International Cricket history. He won the <a href="/wiki/ICC_ODI_Player_of_the_Year" class="mw-redirect" title="ICC ODI Player of the Year">ICC ODI Player of the Year</a> award four times in 2012, 2017, 2018, and 2023. He also won the <a href="/wiki/Sir_Garfield_Sobers_Trophy" title="Sir Garfield Sobers Trophy">Sir Garfield Sobers Trophy</a>, given to the ICC Cricketer of the Year, on two occasions, in 2017 and 2018 respectively. In 2018, he became the first player to win both ICC ODI and <a href="/wiki/ICC_Test_Player_of_the_Year" class="mw-redirect" title="ICC Test Player of the Year">Test Player of the Year</a> awards in the same year. Also, he was named the <a href="/wiki/Wisden_Leading_Cricketer_in_the_World" title="Wisden Leading Cricketer in the World">Wisden Leading Cricketer in the World</a> for three consecutive years, from 2016 to 2018. <a href="/wiki/Player_of_the_Match_awards_(cricket)" title="Player of the Match awards (cricket)">Kohli has the second most and most 'Player of the Match' and 'Player of the Series' awards</a> to his name, respectively, in all three formats combined.  At the national level, Kohli was honoured with the <a href="/wiki/Arjuna_Award" title="Arjuna Award">Arjuna Award</a> in 2013, the <a href="/wiki/Padma_Shri" title="Padma Shri">Padma Shri</a> in 2017, and India's highest sporting honour, the <a href="/wiki/Khel_Ratna_Award" title="Khel Ratna Award">Khel Ratna Award</a>, in 2018. In 2018, <i><a href="/wiki/Time_(magazine)" title="Time (magazine)">Time</a></i> magazine included him on its list of the <a href="/wiki/Time_100" title="Time 100">100 most influential people in the world</a>.
</p><p>After winning the <a href="/wiki/2024_ICC_Men%27s_T20_World_Cup" title="2024 ICC Men's T20 World Cup">2024 T20 World Cup</a> and the Player of the Match in the <a href="/wiki/2024_ICC_Men%27s_T20_World_Cup_final" title="2024 ICC Men's T20 World Cup final">Final</a>, Kohli announced his retirement from T20Is.<sup id="cite_ref-9" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-9"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>8<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<meta property="mw:PageProp/toc">
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="Early_life">Early life</h2></div>
<p>Virat Kohli was born on 5 November 1988 in <a href="/wiki/Delhi" title="Delhi">Delhi</a> into a <a href="/wiki/Punjabi_Hindu" class="mw-redirect" title="Punjabi Hindu">Punjabi Hindu</a> family. His father, Prem Nath Kohli, worked as a criminal lawyer, and his mother, Saroj Kohli, served as a housewife. He has an older brother, Vikas, and an older sister, Bhawna.<sup id="cite_ref-Pratap_Sahi-2011_10-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Pratap_Sahi-2011-10"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>9<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>  Kohli's formative years were spent in <a href="/wiki/Uttam_Nagar" title="Uttam Nagar">Uttam Nagar</a>. He commenced his early education at Vishal Bharti Public School.<sup id="cite_ref-Das-2012_11-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Das-2012-11"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>10<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> According to his family, Kohli exhibited an early affinity for cricket as a three-year-old. He would pick up a <a href="/wiki/Cricket_bat" title="Cricket bat">cricket bat</a> and request his father to bowl to him.<sup id="cite_ref-thisis2_12-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-thisis2-12"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>11<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>In 1998, the <a href="/wiki/West_Delhi_Cricket_Academy" class="mw-redirect" title="West Delhi Cricket Academy">West Delhi Cricket Academy</a> (WDCA) was created. On 30 May of that year, Prem Nath Kohli, who'd espoused his younger son's fervour for cricket, assisted nine-year-old Kohli's aspirations and arranged for him to meet <a href="/wiki/Rajkumar_Sharma_(cricketer)" title="Rajkumar Sharma (cricketer)">Rajkumar Sharma</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTELokapally201613–14_13-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTELokapally201613–14-13"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>12<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Upon the suggestion of their neighbours, Kohli's father considered enrolling his son in a professional cricket academy, as they believed that his cricketing abilities merited more than just playing in <a href="/wiki/Gully_cricket" class="mw-redirect" title="Gully cricket">gully cricket</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-ToI2008_14-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ToI2008-14"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>13<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Despite his abilities, he faced the setback of being unable to secure a place in the under-14 Delhi team, supposedly due to extraneous factors. Prem Kohli reportedly received offers to relocate his son to influential clubs, which would have ensured his selection, but he declined the proposals. Kohli eventually found his way into the under-15 Delhi team.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTELokapally201615–16_15-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTELokapally201615–16-15"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>14<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He received training at the academy while simultaneously participating in matches at the <a href="/wiki/Sumeet_Dogra" title="Sumeet Dogra">Sumeet Dogra</a> Academy located at <a href="/wiki/Vasundhara_Enclave" title="Vasundhara Enclave">Vasundhara Enclave</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-symbol2_16-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-symbol2-16"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>15<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In pursuit of furthering his cricketing career, he transitioned to Saviour Convent School during his ninth-grade education.<sup id="cite_ref-ToI2008_14-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ToI2008-14"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>13<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>On 18 December 2006, Kohli experienced the loss of his father due to a <a href="/wiki/Stroke" title="Stroke">cerebral attack</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-ToI2008_14-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ToI2008-14"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>13<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTELokapally201644_17-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTELokapally201644-17"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>16<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> During his childhood, his father played a crucial role in supporting his cricket training. Kohli has credited his father as the one who drove him to practice every day. He has expressed his feelings of missing his father's presence at times.<sup id="cite_ref-Das-2012_11-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Das-2012-11"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>10<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-18" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-18"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>17<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> According to his mother, Kohli's demeanour shifted noticeably after his father's death. He took cricket with newfound seriousness, prioritizing playing time and dedicating himself fully to the sport.<sup id="cite_ref-ToI2008_14-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ToI2008-14"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>13<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Kohli's family resided in <a href="/wiki/Meera_Bagh" title="Meera Bagh">Meera Bagh</a>, <a href="/wiki/Paschim_Vihar" class="mw-redirect" title="Paschim Vihar">Paschim Vihar</a> until the year 2015, after which they relocated to <a href="/wiki/Gurgaon" title="Gurgaon">Gurgaon</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-19" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-19"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>18<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="Career">Career</h2></div>
<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1236091366"><table class="box-Expand_section plainlinks metadata ambox mbox-small-left ambox-content" role="presentation"><tbody><tr><td class="mbox-image"><span typeof="mw:File"><a href="/wiki/File:Wiki_letter_w_cropped.svg" class="mw-file-description"><img alt="[icon]" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1c/Wiki_letter_w_cropped.svg/20px-Wiki_letter_w_cropped.svg.png" decoding="async" width="20" height="14" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1c/Wiki_letter_w_cropped.svg/30px-Wiki_letter_w_cropped.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1c/Wiki_letter_w_cropped.svg/40px-Wiki_letter_w_cropped.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="44" data-file-height="31"></a></span></td><td class="mbox-text"><div class="mbox-text-span">This section <b>needs expansion</b>. You can help by <a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Virat_Kohli&amp;action=edit&amp;section=">adding to it</a>.  <span class="date-container"><i>(<span class="date">September 2024</span>)</i></span></div></td></tr></tbody></table>
<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1236090951">.mw-parser-output .hatnote{font-style:italic}.mw-parser-output div.hatnote{padding-left:1.6em;margin-bottom:0.5em}.mw-parser-output .hatnote i{font-style:normal}.mw-parser-output .hatnote+link+.hatnote{margin-top:-0.5em}@media print{body.ns-0 .mw-parser-output .hatnote{display:none!important}}</style><div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Career_of_Virat_Kohli" title="Career of Virat Kohli">Career of Virat Kohli</a></div>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="Player_profile">Player profile</h2></div>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Comparisons_to_Sachin_Tendulkar">Comparisons to Sachin Tendulkar</h3></div>
<p>Kohli's batting style and approach to the game have frequently drawn comparisons to the legendary <a href="/wiki/Sachin_Tendulkar" title="Sachin Tendulkar">Sachin Tendulkar</a>, whom he regarded as the epitome of excellence in the sport of cricket. Dubbed as Tendulkar's "successor",<sup id="cite_ref-king2_20-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-king2-20"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>19<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-donald2_21-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-donald2-21"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>20<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> he is widely considered to have the potential to surpass his records in the future.<sup id="cite_ref-22" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-22"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>21<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-23" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-23"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>22<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> His reverence for Tendulkar as a role model, whom he idolized in his formative years and sought to emulate, is well-documented. Kohli has stated that he tried to mirror Tendulkar's style of batting, imitating his shots and attempting to hit sixes in a similar manner.<sup id="cite_ref-24" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-24"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>23<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Kohli's aggressive and dynamic style has earned him accolades from cricketing greats such as Vivian Richards, who has acknowledged Kohli's similarities to his own playing style.<sup id="cite_ref-himself_25-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-himself-25"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>24<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He has been lauded as the "new king of world cricket" by Dean Jones, a former Australian cricketer.<sup id="cite_ref-26" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-26"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>25<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> While Indian commentator <a href="/wiki/Aakash_Chopra" title="Aakash Chopra">Aakash Chopra</a> has noted that Tendulkar possessed a broader array of shots,<sup id="cite_ref-27" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-27"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>26<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Kohli's skills with the bat have earned him accolades from former West Indies great <a href="/wiki/Brian_Lara" title="Brian Lara">Brian Lara</a>, who has ranked him among the best batsmen in the world alongside <a href="/wiki/Joe_Root" title="Joe Root">Joe Root</a>, the England captain at the time.<sup id="cite_ref-28" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-28"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>27<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>In a discourse with the prominent <a href="/wiki/Hindi_cinema" title="Hindi cinema">Bollywood</a> actor <a href="/wiki/Salman_Khan" title="Salman Khan">Salman Khan</a>, Tendulkar proclaimed that Kohli possesses the potential to surpass his record of 100 international centuries. Tendulkar also acknowledged Kohli's batting aptitudes and the steadfastness with which he has accumulated runs.<sup id="cite_ref-29" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-29"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>28<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In 2013, Tendulkar retired from international cricket, marking the end of an era for Indian cricket. Kohli, who played alongside Tendulkar in the team, honoured him by presenting him with a sacred thread that had been gifted to him by his late father. Tendulkar eventually returned the thread to him, imploring that it should remain in his possession.<sup id="cite_ref-30" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-30"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>29<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Playing_style">Playing style</h3></div>
<p>Kohli is considered as an enterprising batsman, possessing technical abilities and a dynamic playing demeanour.<sup id="cite_ref-31" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-31"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>30<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-emerging_32-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-emerging-32"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>31<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> His customarily batting position in ODl cricket is at number three, with a slightly open-chested stance,<sup id="cite_ref-33" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-33"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>32<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> and a resolute grip on the bottom handle of his bat. He has been noted for his agile footwork, expansive range of strokes, and his propensity for adeptly orchestrating innings whilst thriving in high-pressure situations.<sup id="cite_ref-34" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-34"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>33<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-35" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-35"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>34<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In his batting technique, Kohli tends to favour playing grounded shots rather than attempting big hits. He is appreciated for his ability to execute wrist shots and his consistent prowess in the <a href="/wiki/Fielding_(cricket)" title="Fielding (cricket)">mid-wicket</a> and <a href="/wiki/Cover_(cricket)" title="Cover (cricket)">cover</a> region.<sup id="cite_ref-36" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-36"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>35<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-37" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-37"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>36<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<figure class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="/wiki/File:2015_CWC_I_v_UAE_02-28_Kohli_(03)_(cropped).JPG" class="mw-file-description"><img src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a1/2015_CWC_I_v_UAE_02-28_Kohli_%2803%29_%28cropped%29.JPG/220px-2015_CWC_I_v_UAE_02-28_Kohli_%2803%29_%28cropped%29.JPG" decoding="async" width="220" height="233" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a1/2015_CWC_I_v_UAE_02-28_Kohli_%2803%29_%28cropped%29.JPG/330px-2015_CWC_I_v_UAE_02-28_Kohli_%2803%29_%28cropped%29.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a1/2015_CWC_I_v_UAE_02-28_Kohli_%2803%29_%28cropped%29.JPG/440px-2015_CWC_I_v_UAE_02-28_Kohli_%2803%29_%28cropped%29.JPG 2x" data-file-width="747" data-file-height="792"></a><figcaption>Kohli playing his famous flick shot at the <a href="/wiki/2015_Cricket_World_Cup" title="2015 Cricket World Cup">2015 Cricket World Cup</a></figcaption></figure>
<p>Kohli has often expressed his admiration for the <a href="/wiki/Cover_drive_(cricket)" title="Cover drive (cricket)">cover drive</a>, which he considers to be his signature stroke. He possesses a natural aptitude for the <a href="/wiki/Batting_(cricket)" title="Batting (cricket)">flick shot</a>, particularly when facing deliveries aimed towards <a href="/wiki/Leg_stump" class="mw-redirect" title="Leg stump">leg stump</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-thisis2_12-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-thisis2-12"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>11<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Having a limited recourse to the <a href="/wiki/Sweep_shot" class="mw-redirect" title="Sweep shot">sweep shot</a>, Kohli's batting technique is characterized by an emphasis on ground shots that primarily yield runs in the regions between <a href="/wiki/Square_leg" class="mw-redirect" title="Square leg">deep square leg</a> and <a href="/wiki/Mid_on" class="mw-redirect" title="Mid on">mid-on</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-38" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-38"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>37<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Kohli is known for his composed batting technique and versatility in his play. He scores runs between <a href="/wiki/Long_off" class="mw-redirect" title="Long off">long-off</a> and <a href="/wiki/Long_on" class="mw-redirect" title="Long on">long-on</a> with an aligned bat, while also possessing the ability to display a destructive streak. His combination of bat-speed and supple wrist movements enable him to craft innovative angles that disrupt traditional field positioning.<sup id="cite_ref-39" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-39"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>38<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Kohli is also a proficient fielder, recognized for his quick reflexes and sure-handedness.<sup id="cite_ref-40" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-40"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>39<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>However, Kohli has a known vulnerability to deliveries that are wide of the <a href="/wiki/Off_stump" class="mw-redirect" title="Off stump">off-stump</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-41" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-41"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>40<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Bowlers often exploit this weakness by targeting him with such deliveries, especially in Test and ODl matches.<sup id="cite_ref-42" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-42"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>41<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> This vulnerability has resulted in Kohli's dismissal on numerous occasions.<sup id="cite_ref-43" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-43"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>42<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Kohli's_weakness_grows_wider_44-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Kohli's_weakness_grows_wider-44"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>43<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Cricket experts such as <a href="/wiki/VVS_Laxman" title="VVS Laxman">VVS Laxman</a> and former India cricketer <a href="/wiki/Sanjay_Manjrekar" title="Sanjay Manjrekar">Sanjay Manjrekar</a> have acknowledged this weakness,<sup id="cite_ref-45" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-45"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>44<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-46" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-46"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>45<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> and former New Zealand cricketer <a href="/wiki/Richard_Hadlee" title="Richard Hadlee">Richard Hadlee</a> has also noted that Kohli is particularly susceptible to <a href="/wiki/Outswinger" title="Outswinger">out-swinging</a> deliveries.<sup id="cite_ref-47" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-47"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>46<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Kohli has garnered widespread acclaim and recognition as a preeminent limited-overs batsman by cricketing experts and aficionados alike.<sup id="cite_ref-48" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-48"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>47<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-indiatoday.intoday.in_49-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-indiatoday.intoday.in-49"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>48<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In ODIs, he boasts an average of 65.5 runs when batting second and 51.7 runs when batting first.<sup id="cite_ref-odisummary_50-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-odisummary-50"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>49<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He has amassed 27 of his 50 ODI hundreds in run-chases,<sup id="cite_ref-51" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-51"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>50<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> and holds the record for the most hundreds scored when batting second.<sup id="cite_ref-52" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-52"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>51<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In reference to his success while batting second, Kohli has expressed a fondness for the challenge of chasing, relishing the opportunity to test himself and demonstrate his ability to efficiently manage strike rotation and execute boundary hits.<sup id="cite_ref-53" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-53"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>52<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> His colleagues admire his self-assurance, dedication, concentration, and work ethic, which are the driving forces behind his success.<sup id="cite_ref-54" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-54"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>53<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-55" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-55"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>54<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Aggression">Aggression</h3></div>
<p>Kohli's playing style is widely regarded as aggressive, a trait that extends to his leadership on the field. He is well known for his passionate and animated responses to on-field situations, demonstrating a fierce competitiveness.<sup id="cite_ref-56" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-56"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>55<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-57" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-57"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>56<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> His captaincy is characterized as proactive, taking bold decisions and leading the team by example.<sup id="cite_ref-58" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-58"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>57<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Kohli has been the subject of much media scrutiny and criticism in the early stages of his career. He was often portrayed as a brash and arrogant individual, eliciting mixed reactions from fans, critics and former cricketers alike.<sup id="cite_ref-bstd_59-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-bstd-59"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>58<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-60" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-60"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>59<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> While some have praised his assertiveness and confidence,<sup id="cite_ref-61" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-61"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>60<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-62" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-62"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>61<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> others have criticized Kohli's behaviour for crossing the boundaries of fair play and for losing control, sometimes resulting in a loss of composure.<sup id="cite_ref-63" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-63"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>62<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Despite his efforts to curb his aggressive behaviour, Kohli has acknowledged that there are times when intense pressure or high-stakes situations may challenge his resolve. The cricketer has persistently maintained that his aggression acts as a source of inspiration and drives his focus and motivation on the field.<sup id="cite_ref-64" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-64"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>63<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Writing for <i><a href="/wiki/The_New_York_Times" title="The New York Times">The New York Times</a></i>, Huw Richards noted Kohli's self-assuredness and "assertiveness" in contrast to some former Indian cricketers who he felt had exhibited an inclination towards excessive politeness and reticence, and that Kohli embodies his combative demeanour both on and off the cricket field.<sup id="cite_ref-65" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-65"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>64<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="Public_image_and_in_media">Public image and in media</h2></div>
<figure typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="/wiki/File:Virat_Kohli_with_AudiQ7.png" class="mw-file-description"><img src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/44/Virat_Kohli_with_AudiQ7.png/169px-Virat_Kohli_with_AudiQ7.png" decoding="async" width="169" height="230" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/44/Virat_Kohli_with_AudiQ7.png/253px-Virat_Kohli_with_AudiQ7.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/44/Virat_Kohli_with_AudiQ7.png/337px-Virat_Kohli_with_AudiQ7.png 2x" data-file-width="730" data-file-height="995"></a><figcaption>Virat Kohli with <a href="/wiki/Audi_Q7" title="Audi Q7">Audi Q7</a></figcaption></figure>
<p>In 2008, Kohli was approached by <a href="/wiki/Sports_agent" title="Sports agent">sports agent</a> Bunty Sajdeh of Cornerstone Sport and Entertainment after his notable performance in the <a href="/wiki/2008_Under-19_Cricket_World_Cup" title="2008 Under-19 Cricket World Cup">ICC Under-19 World Cup</a>. Sajdeh was impressed with Kohli's leadership skills and attitude and saw great potential in the young cricketer. After being recommended by Yuvraj Singh, Kohli was signed to Cornerstone Sport and Entertainment.<sup id="cite_ref-jerry_66-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-jerry-66"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>65<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Over the years, Kohli's brand endorsement portfolio has experienced significant growth. In 2013, it was reported that his endorsements were valued at over <span class="nowrap"><span style="white-space: nowrap">₹</span>1 billion</span> (US$12&nbsp;million).<sup id="cite_ref-67" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-67"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>66<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In 2023, his brand value reached <span class="nowrap"><span style="white-space: nowrap">₹</span>1,000 crore</span> (US$120&nbsp;million).<sup id="cite_ref-68" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-68"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>67<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> His bat deal with <a href="/wiki/MRF_Limited" class="mw-redirect" title="MRF Limited">MRF</a> is regarded as one of the most financially rewarding deals in cricket history.<sup id="cite_ref-69" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-69"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>68<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In 2017, Kohli entered into a notable endorsement agreement with <a href="/wiki/Puma_(brand)" title="Puma (brand)">Puma</a> that spanned over eight years and was estimated to be worth around <span class="nowrap"><span style="white-space: nowrap">₹</span>1.1 billion</span> (US$13&nbsp;million). This deal made Kohli the first Indian athlete to sign a brand endorsement contract valued at <span class="nowrap"><span style="white-space: nowrap">₹</span>100 crore</span> (equivalent to <span style="white-space: nowrap">₹</span>140&nbsp;crore or US$17&nbsp;million in 2023) deal with a brand.<sup id="cite_ref-70" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-70"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>69<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> As of January&nbsp;2023<sup class="plainlinks noexcerpt noprint asof-tag update" style="display:none;"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Virat_Kohli&amp;action=edit">[update]</a></sup>, Kohli is widely regarded as the most marketable cricketer, with annual earnings estimated at  <span class="nowrap"><span style="white-space: nowrap">₹</span>165 crore</span> (equivalent to <span style="white-space: nowrap">₹</span>175&nbsp;crore or US$21&nbsp;million in 2023).<sup id="cite_ref-71" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-71"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>70<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Kohli is currently recognized as the <a href="/wiki/List_of_most-followed_Instagram_accounts#Most-followed_accounts" title="List of most-followed Instagram accounts">most followed Asian individual</a> on the social media platform <a href="/wiki/Instagram" title="Instagram">Instagram</a>, boasting over 266 million followers on the platform. Reports indicate that he is able to command a fee of <span class="nowrap"><span style="white-space: nowrap">₹</span>8.9 crore</span> (equivalent to <span style="white-space: nowrap">₹</span>9.4&nbsp;crore or US$1.1&nbsp;million in 2023) for each sponsored post on the platform.<sup id="cite_ref-72" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-72"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>71<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<figure typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="/wiki/File:Virat_Kohli%27s_bat_at_Blades_of_Glory_Cricket_Museum,_Pune.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/65/Virat_Kohli%27s_bat_at_Blades_of_Glory_Cricket_Museum%2C_Pune.jpg/129px-Virat_Kohli%27s_bat_at_Blades_of_Glory_Cricket_Museum%2C_Pune.jpg" decoding="async" width="129" height="230" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/65/Virat_Kohli%27s_bat_at_Blades_of_Glory_Cricket_Museum%2C_Pune.jpg/194px-Virat_Kohli%27s_bat_at_Blades_of_Glory_Cricket_Museum%2C_Pune.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/65/Virat_Kohli%27s_bat_at_Blades_of_Glory_Cricket_Museum%2C_Pune.jpg/259px-Virat_Kohli%27s_bat_at_Blades_of_Glory_Cricket_Museum%2C_Pune.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1872" data-file-height="3328"></a><figcaption>Virat Kohli's signed bat at <a href="/wiki/Blades_of_Glory_Cricket_Museum" title="Blades of Glory Cricket Museum">Blades of Glory Cricket Museum</a>, <a href="/wiki/Pune" title="Pune">Pune</a></figcaption></figure>
<p>Kohli has gained international acclaim for his athletic achievements and widespread popularity, earning a prominent place among the world's most renowned athletes, as per <i><a href="/wiki/ESPN" title="ESPN">ESPN</a></i>.<sup id="cite_ref-73" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-73"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>72<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-ESPN's_World_Fame_100_74-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ESPN's_World_Fame_100-74"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>73<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In 2014, <a href="/wiki/American_Appraisal" title="American Appraisal">American Appraisal</a> conducted an evaluation of Kohli's brand value and determined it to be $56.4 million, placing him fourth on the list of India's most valued celebrity brands.<sup id="cite_ref-75" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-75"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>74<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> The following two years saw Kohli's brand value soar higher. As per a report published in October 2016 by <a href="/wiki/Duff_%26_Phelps" class="mw-redirect" title="Duff &amp; Phelps">Duff &amp; Phelps</a>, Kohli's brand worth had increased to $92 million, second only to that of Bollywood actor <a href="/wiki/Shah_Rukh_Khan" title="Shah Rukh Khan">Shah Rukh Khan</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-76" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-76"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>75<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In 2017, Kohli was recognized by <i><a href="/wiki/Forbes" title="Forbes">Forbes</a></i> as the seventh "Most Valuable Brand among Athletes", surpassing renowned sports figures such as <a href="/wiki/Lionel_Messi" title="Lionel Messi">Lionel Messi</a>, <a href="/wiki/Rory_McIlroy" title="Rory McIlroy">Rory McIlroy</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Stephen_Curry" title="Stephen Curry">Stephen Curry</a>, with a brand estimation of $14.5 million.<sup id="cite_ref-77" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-77"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>76<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> By September of the same year, Kohli had amassed endorsement agreements with 17 distinct brands, and he announced that he would only endorse products that he personally uses and believes in.<sup id="cite_ref-78" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-78"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>77<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> The following year, he was featured on <i><a href="/wiki/Time_(magazine)" title="Time (magazine)">Time</a></i> magazine's annual list of the <a href="/wiki/Time_100" title="Time 100">100 most influential people in the world</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-79" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-79"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>78<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In 2019, Kohli was the only cricketer included in Forbes' list of "World's 100 Highest-Paid Athletes". He was ranked 100th on the list, with earnings estimated at $25 million, with $21 million being procured through endorsements, and the remainder from salary and tournament winnings.<sup id="cite_ref-80" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-80"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>79<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Furthermore, in March 2019, Kohli was named the brand ambassador of the mobile esports platform, <a href="/wiki/Mobile_Premier_League" title="Mobile Premier League">Mobile Premier League</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-81" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-81"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>80<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Kohli's earning potential continued to climb, and in 2020, he attained the 66th spot in <i>Forbes</i> compilation of the <a href="/wiki/Forbes%27_list_of_the_world%27s_highest-paid_athletes" class="mw-redirect" title="Forbes' list of the world's highest-paid athletes">top 100 highest-paid athletes in the world for the year 2020</a>, with estimated earnings exceeding $26 million.<sup id="cite_ref-Hindustan_Times_2020-05-30_82-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Hindustan_Times_2020-05-30-82"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>81<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In April 2021, <a href="/wiki/Vivo_(technology_company)" title="Vivo (technology company)"><i>Vivo</i></a> appointed Kohli as their brand ambassador ahead of the Indian Premier League.<sup id="cite_ref-83" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-83"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>82<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>In 2012, Kohli was recognized as one of the best-dressed men by the fashion magazine <i><a href="/wiki/GQ" title="GQ">GQ</a></i>, appearing on their annual list alongside prominent figures such as <a href="/wiki/Barack_Obama" title="Barack Obama">Barack Obama</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-84" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-84"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>83<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Six years later, in 2018, a documentary highlighting Kohli's cricketing career was released on <i><a href="/wiki/National_Geographic" title="National Geographic">National Geographic</a></i> channel. The film aimed to celebrate his accomplishments in the sport.<sup id="cite_ref-85" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-85"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>84<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> The following year, on the eve of the <a href="/wiki/2019_Cricket_World_Cup" title="2019 Cricket World Cup">2019 Cricket World Cup</a> a tribute was bestowed upon Kohli. <a href="/wiki/Madame_Tussauds" title="Madame Tussauds">Madame Tussauds</a> renowned for their lifelike wax figures, unveiled an exquisite creation of Kohli in London.<sup id="cite_ref-86" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-86"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>85<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Continuing the string of accolades, in 2019, on the eleventh anniversary of his international debut, Kohli was honoured with a stand named after him at the <a href="/wiki/Feroz_Shah_Kotla_Stadium" class="mw-redirect" title="Feroz Shah Kotla Stadium">Feroz Shah Kotla Stadium</a> in Delhi, making him the youngest cricketer to receive such a recognition.<sup id="cite_ref-The_Indian_Express-2019_87-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-The_Indian_Express-2019-87"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>86<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In November of the same year, an Indian animated superhero television series entitled <i><a href="/wiki/Super_V" title="Super V">Super V</a></i> premiered, featuring a fictionalized portrayal of Kohli's teenage years and his discovery of superpowers.<sup id="cite_ref-88" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-88"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>87<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="Personal_life">Personal life</h2></div>
<figure typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="/wiki/File:Virat_Kohali_and_Anushka_Sharma_at_Mumbai_reception.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/91/Virat_Kohali_and_Anushka_Sharma_at_Mumbai_reception.jpg/140px-Virat_Kohali_and_Anushka_Sharma_at_Mumbai_reception.jpg" decoding="async" width="140" height="247" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/91/Virat_Kohali_and_Anushka_Sharma_at_Mumbai_reception.jpg/210px-Virat_Kohali_and_Anushka_Sharma_at_Mumbai_reception.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/91/Virat_Kohali_and_Anushka_Sharma_at_Mumbai_reception.jpg/280px-Virat_Kohali_and_Anushka_Sharma_at_Mumbai_reception.jpg 2x" data-file-width="585" data-file-height="1031"></a><figcaption>Kohli with wife <a href="/wiki/Anushka_Sharma" title="Anushka Sharma">Anushka Sharma</a> in their Mumbai reception</figcaption></figure>
<p>Kohli's romantic association with Bollywood actress <a href="/wiki/Anushka_Sharma" title="Anushka Sharma">Anushka Sharma</a>, which commenced in 2013, earned the duo the <a href="/wiki/Moniker" class="mw-redirect" title="Moniker">moniker</a> of "Virushka".<sup id="cite_ref-89" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-89"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>88<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> During an interview with <a href="/wiki/Graham_Bensinger" title="Graham Bensinger">Graham Bensinger</a>, Kohli divulged that he had encountered Sharma for the first time, when they were both were engaged in a promotional shoot for <a href="/wiki/Clear_(shampoo)" title="Clear (shampoo)">Clear shampoo</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-90" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-90"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>89<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Their union since then has attracted significant media interest, with persistent rumours and speculations swirling around in the press, as both parties remained reticent about publicly discussing the relationship.<sup id="cite_ref-91" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-91"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>90<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> On 11 December 2017, the couple exchanged nuptials in an intimate ceremony held in <a href="/wiki/Florence" title="Florence">Florence</a>, <a href="/wiki/Italy" title="Italy">Italy</a>, becoming one of the most talked-about celebrity couples in the country.<sup id="cite_ref-92" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-92"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>91<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> On 11 January 2021, the couple had their first child, a daughter, who was named Vamika.<sup id="cite_ref-93" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-93"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>92<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> The child's name, Vamika, is derived from Sanskrit, meaning "little goddess".<sup id="cite_ref-94" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-94"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>93<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> On 15 February 2024, the couple welcomed their second child, a boy named Akaay.<sup id="cite_ref-95" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-95"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>94<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>In 2018, Kohli disclosed that he had made the decision to adopt a <a href="/wiki/Vegetarian_cuisine" title="Vegetarian cuisine">vegetarian diet</a> in an effort to alleviate the symptoms of a <a href="/wiki/Cervical_vertebrae" title="Cervical vertebrae">cervical spine</a> issue caused by elevated levels of <a href="/wiki/Uric_acid" title="Uric acid">uric acid</a>. This condition was impacting his finger movements, and thus, affecting his performance as a batsman. He made a conscious effort to abstain from consuming meat, as part of his regimen for maintaining optimal health.<sup id="cite_ref-96" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-96"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>95<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He has since clarified that his dietary choices do not align with a <a href="/wiki/Veganism" title="Veganism">vegan lifestyle</a> and he continues to consume dairy products and eggs effectively making what is known in India as an <a href="/wiki/Eggetarian" class="mw-redirect" title="Eggetarian">eggetarian</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-97" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-97"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>96<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-98" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-98"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>97<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-99" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-99"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>98<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Kohli is widely recognized for his <a href="/wiki/Physical_fitness" title="Physical fitness">physical fitness</a> and intense training regimen.<sup id="cite_ref-100" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-100"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>99<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He has been an advocate of leading a healthy lifestyle, which involves regular exercise and a nutritious diet. His hard work and discipline in this area have earned him the reputation of being one of the fittest cricketers in the world.<sup id="cite_ref-101" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-101"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>100<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Kohli has acknowledged to harbour a belief in superstitions. He has publicly avowed his reliance upon various lucky charms and rituals that he feels serve to bring him good fortune on the cricket field. One such tradition involves the donning of black <a href="/wiki/Wristband" title="Wristband">wristbands</a>, which he adheres to as a talismanic tradition. Additionally, he is known to prefer a particular pair of gloves, which he has consistently worn due to their supposed propensity to bring him success.<sup id="cite_ref-Pratap_Sahi-2011_10-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Pratap_Sahi-2011-10"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>9<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Furthermore, Kohli has been observed sporting a <a href="/wiki/Kara_(Sikhism)" title="Kara (Sikhism)">kara</a>, a traditional bangle often worn for religious or spiritual purposes, on his right arm since 2012.<sup id="cite_ref-102" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-102"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>101<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In addition to the previously mentioned superstitions, Kohli has also established the ritual of consistently donning white shoes on the cricket field.<sup id="cite_ref-103" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-103"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>102<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Kohli has <a href="/wiki/Tattoo" title="Tattoo">tattoos</a> of the revered Hindu deity <a href="/wiki/Shiva" title="Shiva">Lord Shiva</a>, the sacred syllable "<a href="/wiki/Om" title="Om">Om</a>", the names of his parents, Prem and Saroj, a <a href="/wiki/Adivasi" title="Adivasi">tribal emblem</a>, a representation of a serene monastery, a <a href="/wiki/Samurai" title="Samurai">samurai</a> warrior, the astrological symbol of the <a href="/wiki/Scorpio_(astrology)" title="Scorpio (astrology)">scorpion</a>, and his ODl and Test match cap numbers.<sup id="cite_ref-104" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-104"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>103<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-105" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-105"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>104<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="Outside_cricket">Outside cricket</h2></div>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Commercial_investments">Commercial investments</h3></div>
<figure class="mw-halign-left" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="/wiki/File:Virat_Kohli_June_2016_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e9/Virat_Kohli_June_2016_%28cropped%29.jpg/173px-Virat_Kohli_June_2016_%28cropped%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="173" height="216" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/e/e9/Virat_Kohli_June_2016_%28cropped%29.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="227" data-file-height="283"></a><figcaption>Kohli at the opening ceremony of the <a href="/wiki/Pro_Kabaddi_League" title="Pro Kabaddi League">Pro Kabaddi League</a> in June 2016</figcaption></figure>
<p>Kohli invested in <a href="/wiki/Indian_Super_League" title="Indian Super League">Indian Super League</a> club <a href="/wiki/FC_Goa" title="FC Goa">FC Goa</a>, which he co-owned as of 2024, reflects his ambition to support and cultivate the growth of football in India. Beyond the realm of cricket, this venture served as a future business opportunity for him, as he sought to diversify his portfolio after retirement from the sport.<sup id="cite_ref-106" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-106"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>105<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In November 2014, Kohli partnered with Anjana Reddy's <i>Universal Sportsbiz (USPL)</i> to launch the youth fashion brand <i>WROGN</i>. The brand specialized in men's casual wear clothing and entered into collaborations with prominent retail outlets such as <a href="/wiki/Myntra" title="Myntra">Myntra</a> and <a href="/wiki/Shoppers_Stop" title="Shoppers Stop">Shopper's Stop</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-107" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-107"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>106<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Additionally, in late 2014, Kohli became a shareholder and brand ambassador for the London-based social networking venture "Sport Convo". His involvement aimed to promote and raise awareness of the platform, which was focused on providing a space for sports fans to connect and engage with one another.<sup id="cite_ref-108" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-108"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>107<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>In 2015, Kohli invested a sum of <span class="nowrap"><span style="white-space: nowrap">₹</span>90 crore</span> (US$11&nbsp;million) towards the establishment of a chain of health clubs and fitness centers throughout India. Dubbed as "<i>Chisel</i>", the network of gyms was established through a joint venture between Kohli, Chisel India, and CSE (Cornerstone Sport and Entertainment), the organization responsible for managing Kohli's commercial pursuits.<sup id="cite_ref-109" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-109"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>108<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In September of the same year, Kohli expanded his portfolio of sports-related investments by becoming a co-owner of the <a href="/wiki/International_Premier_Tennis_League" title="International Premier Tennis League">International Premier Tennis League</a> franchise, <a href="/wiki/UAE_Royals" title="UAE Royals">UAE Royals</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-110" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-110"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>109<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In quick succession, he also became a co-owner of the <a href="/wiki/JSW_Group" title="JSW Group">JSW</a>-owned Bengaluru Yodhas franchise in the <a href="/wiki/Pro_Wrestling_League" title="Pro Wrestling League">Pro Wrestling League</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-111" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-111"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>110<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>In the year 2016, Kohli embarked on a new venture, which aimed to promote fitness among children. He joined forces with <i>Stepathlon Lifestyle</i> to launch Stepathlon Kids. The initiative aimed to encourage young individuals to adopt healthy lifestyle habits and inculcate the love for physical activity<i>.</i><sup id="cite_ref-112" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-112"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>111<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>In 2017, Kohli entered into a partnership with the German sportswear brand, <a href="/wiki/Puma_(brand)" title="Puma (brand)">Puma</a>, to launch his athletic lifestyle brand, <i>One8</i>. This brand offers a range of sport-related apparel, footwear, and accessories designed for active individuals.<sup id="cite_ref-113" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-113"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>112<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> That same year, Kohli also established Nueva, a fine dining establishment located in New Delhi. The restaurant features a South American-inspired decor accentuated with <a href="/wiki/Indigenous_peoples_of_the_Americas" title="Indigenous peoples of the Americas">Native American</a> artwork, providing a distinctive culinary setting.<sup id="cite_ref-114" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-114"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>113<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Kohli also established <i>One8 Commune</i>, a chain of restaurant-bars that offer a modern and sophisticated ambiance that appeals to a diverse age range. This marked his inaugural foray into the food and beverage industry. The first outlet of this restaurant was launched in 2017.<sup id="cite_ref-115" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-115"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>114<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>In 2022, Kohli and his spouse made an investment of <span class="nowrap"><span style="white-space: nowrap">₹</span>2.5 crore</span> (equivalent to <span style="white-space: nowrap">₹</span>2.9&nbsp;crore or US$350,000 in 2023) in <i>Digit</i>, an insurance-based startup.<sup id="cite_ref-116" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-116"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>115<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Additionally, they also extended their support to <i>Blue Tribe</i>, a startup that specializes in the production and distribution of <a href="/wiki/Plant-based_meat" class="mw-redirect" title="Plant-based meat">plant-based meat</a> products. Driven by his own inclination towards a plant-based diet, Kohli aims to raise awareness and encourage individuals to adopt more sustainable and environmentally conscious practices.<sup id="cite_ref-117" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-117"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>116<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Philanthropy">Philanthropy</h3></div>
<figure typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="/wiki/File:Virat_Kohli_charity.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/01/Virat_Kohli_charity.jpg/227px-Virat_Kohli_charity.jpg" decoding="async" width="227" height="151" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/01/Virat_Kohli_charity.jpg/341px-Virat_Kohli_charity.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/01/Virat_Kohli_charity.jpg/454px-Virat_Kohli_charity.jpg 2x" data-file-width="585" data-file-height="390"></a><figcaption>Virat Kohli at charity dinner for Smile Foundation</figcaption></figure>
<p>In 2013, Kohli founded the "Virat Kohli Foundation" with a philanthropic objective to support underprivileged children.<sup id="cite_ref-118" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-118"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>117<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> The foundation collaborates with a selected group of <a href="/wiki/Non-governmental_organization" title="Non-governmental organization">NGOs</a> to increase awareness and gather support for various causes that are instrumental in advancing their mission of promoting the welfare and well-being of these children.<sup id="cite_ref-119" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-119"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>118<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-120" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-120"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>119<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In 2014, the foundation participated in a charity auction organized by <a href="/wiki/EBay" title="EBay">eBay</a> and <a href="/wiki/Save_the_Children" title="Save the Children">Save the Children</a> India, the proceeds of which were directed towards the education and healthcare of underprivileged children.<sup id="cite_ref-121" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-121"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>120<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Kohli is dedicated to creating a brighter future for children by implementing sports-based programs and providing them with necessary resources, leveraging his connections and partnerships to uplift marginalized segments of society.<sup id="cite_ref-122" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-122"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>121<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Kohli's foundation has organized several charity events to raise funds for its causes, including football matches featuring prominent Indian cricketers and Bollywood actors. The first such event was a celebrity football match in collaboration with <a href="/wiki/Abhishek_Bachchan" title="Abhishek Bachchan">Abhishek Bachchan</a>'s charity foundation, which drew significant media attention and was successful in raising funds.<sup id="cite_ref-123" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-123"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>122<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In this match, Kohli captained the All Hearts FC against the All Stars FC, led by Abhishek Bachchan.<sup id="cite_ref-124" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-124"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>123<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Another charity football match, dubbed the "Celebrity Clasico", was held in June 2016 in Mumbai, with Kohli once again leading the All Hearts FC against the All Stars FC, captained by <a href="/wiki/Ranbir_Kapoor" title="Ranbir Kapoor">Ranbir Kapoor</a>. This event was also a major success in generating funds for charity.<sup id="cite_ref-125" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-125"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>124<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>In 2016, the Virat Kohli Foundation entered into a partnership with Smile Foundation to promote the empowerment of underprivileged children and young people. To kickstart this initiative, Kohli organized a philanthropic dinner at <a href="/wiki/Grand_Hyatt_Mumbai" title="Grand Hyatt Mumbai">Grand Hyatt, Mumbai</a>, graced by the presence of cricketing luminaries such as MS Dhoni, Shikhar Dhawan, Yuvraj Singh, Ajinkya Rahane, and <a href="/wiki/KL_Rahul" title="KL Rahul">KL Rahul</a> to support the cause of child and youth empowerment.<sup id="cite_ref-126" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-126"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>125<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> To advance the goals of the <a href="/wiki/Swachh_Bharat_Mission" title="Swachh Bharat Mission">Swachh Bharat Mission</a> (SBM), which aims at creating a cleaner India, Kohli and the Indian cricket team, in collaboration with <a href="/wiki/Anurag_Thakur" title="Anurag Thakur">Anurag Thakur</a>, undertook a cleaning initiative at the <a href="/wiki/Eden_Gardens" title="Eden Gardens">Eden Gardens</a> on the occasion of <a href="/wiki/Gandhi_Jayanti" title="Gandhi Jayanti">Gandhi Jayanti</a> of 2016.<sup id="cite_ref-127" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-127"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>126<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Prior to a match against Sri Lanka in the <a href="/wiki/2017_Champions_Trophy" class="mw-redirect" title="2017 Champions Trophy">2017 Champions Trophy</a>, Kohli hosted a benevolent gala event in London in support of the Justice and Care organization. The ball was arranged with the objective of increasing both funds and awareness for the humanitarian cause championed by Justice and Care. The organization endeavors to combat the pernicious issues of human trafficking and contemporary slavery.<sup id="cite_ref-128" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-128"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>127<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In 2017, Kohli established the Athlete Development Programme (ADP) as a platform for nurturing and supporting aspiring young athletes. This initiative provides comprehensive guidance to these young athletes in areas such as coaching, training, fitness, competition, and nutrition, thereby fostering their growth and development. The program has proven beneficial to several young sports persons, including tennis player Swastika Ghosh and golfer <a href="/wiki/Aadil_Bedi" title="Aadil Bedi">Aadil Bedi</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-129" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-129"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>128<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>In response to the <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic" title="COVID-19 pandemic">COVID-19 pandemic</a> of 2020, Kohli and his wife Anushka Sharma pledged donations to the <a href="/wiki/PM_CARES_Fund" title="PM CARES Fund">PM CARES Fund</a> and the Maharashtra CM Relief Fund.<sup id="cite_ref-130" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-130"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>129<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> The couple has a strong passion for animal welfare and have made personal contributions towards wildlife relief efforts. Through his support of <a href="/wiki/Awaaz_Foundation" title="Awaaz Foundation">Awaaz</a>, Kohli seeks to provide comprehensive medical services, shelter, and sustenance to stray animals.<sup id="cite_ref-131" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-131"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>130<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="Career_summary">Career summary</h2></div>
<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1236090951"><div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/List_of_international_cricket_centuries_by_Virat_Kohli" title="List of international cricket centuries by Virat Kohli">List of international cricket centuries by Virat Kohli</a></div>
<p>Kohli has made 80 <a href="/wiki/Century_(cricket)" title="Century (cricket)">centuries</a> which includes 7 double centuries in international cricket—29 centuries including 7 double centuries in <a href="/wiki/Test_cricket" title="Test cricket">Test cricket</a>, 50 centuries in <a href="/wiki/One_Day_International" title="One Day International">One Day Internationals</a> (ODIs) surpassing the record of Sachin Tendulkar, and 1 century in <a href="/wiki/Twenty20_International" title="Twenty20 International">T20I</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-132" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-132"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>131<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Test_match_performance">Test match performance</h3></div>
<figure class="mw-halign-center" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="/wiki/File:Virat_Kohli_Test_Graph.png" class="mw-file-description"><img src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f7/Virat_Kohli_Test_Graph.png/640px-Virat_Kohli_Test_Graph.png" decoding="async" width="640" height="258" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f7/Virat_Kohli_Test_Graph.png/960px-Virat_Kohli_Test_Graph.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f7/Virat_Kohli_Test_Graph.png/1280px-Virat_Kohli_Test_Graph.png 2x" data-file-width="1503" data-file-height="605"></a><figcaption>An innings-by-innings breakdown of Kohli's Test batting career, showing runs scored (blue and red (not out) bars) and the black line is his career batting average.</figcaption></figure>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="ODI_match_performance">ODI match performance</h3></div>
